discourse_list.title: Why's growth core unit is not focusing on Indian & Vietnam markets?

content.content: Hi Folks! India and Vietnam saw a very good adoption rate in the last bull run, but it’s very sad to see very less growth efforts from Maker. India is hosting one of the largest events ETHIndia where I don’t see a presence, Apart from this India got good devs(Young talent) check the lens protocol projects majority of the famous ones are built by Indian folks also there’re many gamers in Vietnam trying many different games every day, why don’t you guys try some social engineering tools like learn to earn mobile games…etc Open to add inputs

Both India and Vietnam have many important users for the Maker protocol, and we do indeed collaborate a lot in such markets. For example, many Indian exchanges support Dai and have been working with payment services there as well. Many that are based in Vietnam such as Axie Infinity have been early partners of Maker, supporting Dai. I was just in Vietnam presenting at ETH Ho Chi Minh City and Buidl event actually.

You mentioned you got important users from India, So I am assuming by users you mean the “DAI traders/holders”. If you see the DAI volume in all the major centralized exchanges from India it’s close to ZERO, you also mentioned you’re working with payment services by this I am assuming the onramp solutions, do you know there are no major projects which figured out onramp solution from India as there’s no legal clarity from India, you can trade crypto-crypto but as soon as you trade crypto-inr it’s a taxable event. I see you were in Vietnam, what did you achieve?  Where did you represent Maker or DAI? You were totally promoting Stablenode. Where’s the branding of MakerDAO? Here are the links to your Vietnam trip  twitter.com    StableNode @StableNode  Vietnam 🇻🇳 is the host of @buidl_asia in SEP.  Know "The State of DeFi ecosystems in Asia" from StableNode co-founder @DooWanNam & panellists: - @loi_luu, @KyberNetwork - @Itsalexbentley, @ChorusOne - Glenn Woo, @BlockdaemonHQ - moderated by @samanthawyap buidl.asia https://t.co/nIDpYgpHqR   3:44 PM - 20 Sep 2022           13                2              twitter.com    ericakang.eth @ekang426  Independence Palace, a historical landmark as well as the venue of @buidl_asia Vietnam, is absolutely mindblowing! We look forward to welcoming you tomorrow ❤  Agenda: buidl.asia https://t.co/zzV5DazrK5      9:13 AM - 22 Sep 2022           41                6              twitter.com    StableNode @StableNode  Full house at @buidl_asia. Vietnamese are keen on gaining knowledge in a bear market.  Meet us and let's talk decentralized governance, DAOs, delegation, marketing initiatives & more. 👋 @DooWanNam - Co-founder and COO 👋 @AlexPopescu082 - Head of marketing https://t.co/dQGGNDep4d    4:59 AM - 23 Sep 2022           12                2            Also posting a few reference images here  Screenshot 2022-11-10 at 5.40.21 PM713×619 22.9 KB   Screenshot 2022-11-10 at 5.38.09 PM749×553 35.6 KB  Not pulling the legs of anyone but I think we’re lacking somewhere.

ihsotas:  You mentioned you got important users from India, So I am assuming by users you mean the “DAI traders/holders”. If you see the DAI volume in all the major centralized exchanges from India it’s close to ZERO,   I think the important part is now the users can access them in the first place. For the longest time, they couldn’t even access Dai via such exchanges. As you are aware, Dai liquidity on centralized exchange itself is quite low compared to other stablecoins (Dai is often more liquid in DEX side) so it’s not unique to just exchanges based in India.     ihsotas:  You were totally promoting Stablenode. Where’s the branding of MakerDAO?   I can promote StableNode and talk about Maker governance. As you can see, I am not a Maker Core Unit anymore. And within governance, there are many interesting developments happening at MakerDAO.

Access without interest is nothing. Yes, liquidity might be low on CEXs but not Zero in any global centralized exchange. I feel activity around these regions will bring awareness, which will improve DAI adoption. Yes, you can talk about anything you want, but I feel you’re lying by saying you talk about MakerDAO by not wearing the Maker apparel.

I think this is an overly harsh personal attack on @Doo_StableLab - in our experience working with Doo, he has been level-headed, deliberate, and principled in his comments and approach. And I say this particularly because Doo voted against our Arranger Proposal, which was in line with his public stance. All that being said, your points are valid and there is a lot more to accomplish for Maker and the ecosystem ahead. I’m sure I speak for most when I say that any constructive ideas to do so would be celebrated if proposed. Thanks! Kev

Bro please, I am not trying to be harsh. I know Doo is a good man, but I feel data-oriented discussions make sense over subjective things in Marketing. Yes, I am going to outline my thoughts on the @Corina thread
you’re not wrong about the data-oriented discussions > subjective! we agree and look forward to reading

Hey @ihsotas, thanks for the feedback! We know the importance of the Vietnamese and Indian markets for crypto, and we have spent quite a time on these markets in the past. Let me give you some context about what we have done (I think it’ll be interesting for you and the maker community) and why you might perceive that we have reduced our efforts there: India. The cap gains tax of 30% on cryptos in India makes it non-profitable or extra difficult for traders to trade cryptos. And therefore we have to think out of the box, we have to generate different use cases other than just getting DAI on exchanges and then run marketing campaigns to promote DAI adoption, and it simply doesn’t work that way. Indian tax regime, has pushed a lot of traders into decentralized exchanges. And so what we have been doing is to work with a few closer defi counterparts, for example, instadapp. We support them through a co-marketing campaign with them a few months ago: https://twitter.com/instadapp/status/1518989194735288320?s=46&t=n8tHBJZwujNMo5bU5UyWwQ. That’s another reason why DAI volume is extremely low there, CEX are using for onramp and it’ll always be better to do it with other stablecoins with higher liquidity. And we are also constantly looking for different use cases for India. For example, growth core unit has been in preliminary talks to a family office in India where they have close ties with some of the oldest banks and NBFCs (Non-banking financial companies) to finance pre-owned commercial vehicles, gold loans and home loans. And hopefully, we can replicate the same use case with HVB in India. But this all takes time. Vietnam. We have DAI listed on many exchanges in Vietnam. And in fact, most of them prefer to trade P2P. The most commonly used one is called Remitano and they’re only listing the mainstream tokens. And Vietnamese users are generally speculative traders (very similar to the entire SEA). Inflation is 3.6% which is actually under control and considered the lowest in the entire SEA. People use stables because they don’t trust the government there, not entirely because there is inflation. Inbound and outbound remittance is huge (the same goes for the Philippines) but that’s something we haven’t been able to tackle (as remittances are all about liquidity and infrastructure). And gamefi sort of fizzles out after the Ronin hack. And there isn’t a lot of user growth on Axie after the hack. It would be interesting to find out what kinda games the Filipinos and Vietnamese are playing from the poster, if you could help us with this, that would be great. Generally speaking, our strategy has changed after the endgame plan approval, and that’s why we are not attending to ETHIndia. As I said before, I really appreciate your feedback and would love to collaborate with you in the future with anything aligned with Maker’s priorities. If you want to learn more about what we have done in these markets, please feel free to contact @joce_chang.

Hi Nadia! This make sense, but what’s stopping you to attend the events like ETH India where you will get to interact with web3 folks and it may also help in figuring out more contributors to maker ecosystem? Yeah! Axie is kinda of dead in Vietnam now and P2E is not working anymore. Could you help me with the goal that Maker is aligned towards which will help me research more on this part and add more here

ihsotas:  This make sense, but what’s stopping you to attend the events like ETH India where you will get to interact with web3 folks and it may also help in figuring out more contributors to maker ecosystem?   Maker is cutting lot of expenses and budgets, travels included, but online things could be something…
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
